## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.



```

pacman::p_load(pacman, apaTables, dplyr, GGally, ggdist, ggplot2, ggthemes, 
               ggvis, httr, lubridate, plotly, rio, rmarkdown, shiny, stat_dots,
               stringr, tidyr, psych, tidyverse, car) 
par(mfrow = c(1,1))
mpg %>%
  filter(cyl %in% c(4,6,8)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = factor(cyl), y = hwy, fill = factor(cyl))) +
  ggdist::stat_halfeye(
    adjust = 0.5,
    justification = -2,
    .width = 0,
    point_colour = NA
  ) +
  geom_boxplot(
    width = .12,
    outlier.colour = NA,
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  ggdist::stat_dots(
    side = "left",
    justification = 1.1,
    binwidth = .25
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "raincloud Plot",
    subtitle = "Showing the Bi-modal distribution of blabla",
    x = "Engine size",
    y = "MPG",
    fill = "cyl"
  ) +
  coord_flip()

pacman::p_load(ggpubr, stat_comparison_means)  





# Violin plots with box plots inside

# add boxplot with white fill color
ggviolin(data1, x = "diagnosis", y = "age", fill = "diagnosis",
         palette = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
         add = "boxplot", add.params = list(fill = "white"))







stat_compare_means(comparisons = my_comparisons, label = "p.signif")+ # Add significance levels
  stat_compare_means(label.y = 50)
```
